image.altText: WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch stands in uniform outside a building.

props.synopsis: WA Police launch a "significant" response after three people posing as police officers enter a Girrawheen home before tying up one of the occupants and brutally bashing his partner.

title.children: Police release graphic image of victim after three men pose as police before bashing woman in home invasion

image.altText: Former Bishop of Broome Christopher Saunders departs Broome Magistrate's Court alongside supporters.

props.synopsis: Two new indecent assault charges are laid against the 74-year-old former Broome Bishop after his house was raided by police early on Wednesday morning.

title.children: Former Broome Bishop Christopher Saunders charged with more sex offences

image.altText: A father and two sons smile in front of a mountain.

props.synopsis: Thomas Kelly's parents have suffered more heartbreak than most. Now, with their son's killer to be released in a matter of days, they say they were lied to by Corrective Services NSW ahead of Kieran Loveridge's parole.

title.children: 'He will reoffend': Thomas Kelly's family only learned Kieran Loveridge was still violent at his parole hearing

image.altText: Woman opens a door with a key

props.synopsis: Renters in WA will soon be allowed to keep a pet, hang a painting, and only have their rent raised a maximum of once a year — but they still run the risk of being evicted for no reason.

title.children: WA's rental laws are getting an overhaul. Here's everything you need to know about what's changing

image.altText: A young man poses for a photo on a cliff face, with mountains behind him.

props.synopsis: University student Benjamin Cohen was falsely accused of being the stabber behind the Bondi Junction Westfield attack on Saturday, following misinformation that was spread online.

title.children: Man wrongly identified as Bondi Junction stabber pursues defamation case against Network Seven

image.altText: A photo of the torso of a police officer wearing a high vis vest.

props.synopsis: WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch says the effort to stem the flow of officers leaving the force is well short of its promised target.

title.children: WA Police about 500 recruits short of recruitment target to boost officer numbers

image.altText: Sparsely stocked supermarket shelves.

props.synopsis: Dairy products, meat and other groceries are set to remain in limited supply across Western Australia for at least another week, as supermarkets struggle to recover after widespread flooding cut off critical transport routes last month.

title.children: More empty shelves ahead in WA supermarkets as Coles and Woolworths try to restock stores

image.altText: Men kneel in prayer inside a mosque.

props.synopsis: The secretary of the Lebanese Muslim Association says he sat with the family of the teenager accused of stabbing a bishop on Monday night, and has called for harmony following the unrest.

title.children: Father of teenager alleged to be behind church stabbing was in 'shock' following attack

image.altText: A woman stands thoughtfully in front of colourful artwork

props.synopsis: A community leader says youth crime will not improve until the impacts of generations of damaging government policy are addressed, after police take a group of children into custody.

title.children: Poverty blamed as regional police lock-up filled with children after alleged crime spree

image.altText: A composite image of a man holding knife and man with surfboard

props.synopsis: A month ago, Joel Cauchi's parents were relieved to see a text message showing him enjoying life at the beach. Next time they saw him it was on national television as he attacked people in a Sydney shopping centre.

title.children: Five weeks ago, Joel Cauchi sent his parents a message from a beach. The next time they saw him was on the news

image.altText: Richard Marles speaking at a podium in the National press Club

props.synopsis: Australia's projected defence spending will increase by another $50 billion over the next decade, the defence minister has revealed in releasing Labor's long-awaited National Defence Strategy.

title.children: Richard Marles unveils $50 billion defence spending increase over next decade

image.altText: close up of pvc pipe sticking into black mud

props.synopsis: After years hearing locals complain about a terrible smell at an internationally renowned WA wetland, the state government has started work to remove black sludge caused by run-off from farms, gardens and septic tanks.

title.children: Noxious black ooze that 'choked' residents with rotten egg smell to be removed from WA wetland

image.altText: A container ship beneath a collapsed metal bridge

props.synopsis: It's been three weeks since Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge collapsed under the impact of a wayward cargo ship. In the midst of an FBI investigation, a remarkable story of survival has emerged.

title.children: 'He fought for his life': Survival tale emerges weeks after Baltimore Bridge collapse

image.altText: Horse in a stable.

props.synopsis: The Wagga Wagga City Council says the horses appear to have been slaughtered over a long period of time, with some killed "relatively recently".

title.children: More than 500 butchered horses found at property allegedly operating as illegal knackery

image.altText: Composite image of woman pouring a beer and a cash only sign on the door

props.synopsis: While many businesses across Australia are becoming cashless, Western Australia's King River Tavern only accepts cash — and its owner Sam James says the approach has struck a mostly positive chord.

title.children: 'They can get some out or miss out': Cash-only country pub gets tick from punters

image.altText: An image of Brittany Higgins next to an image of Bruce Lehrmann.

props.synopsis: Justice Michael Lee leaned in to the Shakespearean tragedy of Bruce Lehrmann's case and with the narrative muscularity of a literary thriller showed simplicity and complexity need not be enemies. As his judgment took form it became clear he had an altogether more useful verdict in mind.

title.children: The public battle between 'Team Higgins' and 'Team Lehrmann' revealed the most frightening trap of tribalism

image.altText: Exterior of building with Live Better signage and garden

props.synopsis: The NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission and care provider Live Better have reached an agreement in the Federal Court regarding the death of 28-year-old Kyah Lucas, who died in 2022 after being burnt in bath water that was too hot.

title.children: Disability support service Live Better fined $1.8m after woman dies from burning-hot bath

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

props.synopsis: What happened between Bruce Lehrmann and Brittany Higgins in a ministerial suite at Parliament House in March 2019 has triggered at least a dozen avenues of legal action so far — and the costs of all this litigation are set to be many millions.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's costs in failed defamation case set to be astronomically high

image.altText: A man sits on the Playschool set with stuffed toys.

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Luke Springer — better known as Mr Luke — reveals the splurges he refuses to give up, and how getting called upon by a debt collector paved the way for an important financial victory.

title.children: How an unexpected call from a debt collector paved the way for one of Mr Luke's biggest financial wins

image.altText: A cane toad's head.

props.synopsis: The cane toad is spreading in northern Australia, but researchers have found a way to protect apex predators from the toxic pest and it's all a matter of taste.

title.children: Researchers unleash 'teacher toads' in bid to stop goannas eating deadly pest

image.altText: A young girl named Taylah Payne smiles while holding a skateboard as another person skates behind her.

props.synopsis: One of the world's most coveted urban skateboarding locations is facing an uncertain future, as Perth property developers plan to turn the site into a retail and commercial office space.

title.children: It's skaters vs developers as locals fight to stop a global skateboarding mecca being turned into retail hub

image.altText: map and portrait of Indigenous elder with a hat

props.synopsis: Seventy years after law prevented Aubrey Lynch from entering the centre of Kalgoorlie, the Wongatha elder hopes a truth-telling exhibition can provide a way forward.

title.children: Aubrey remembers being 'very frightened' about prohibited area laws as a child. He wants you to know the history

image.altText: A white brick building with flowers on the ground and a sign that reads National Hotel

props.synopsis: The Victorian gold rush town of Clunes is usually quiet, except when the annual Book Fair is being held, but this month it's been in the news for all the wrong reasons.

title.children: 'Shocked and sad' locals in tiny Goldfields town to band together after being rocked by another untimely death

image.altText: A graphic of John Coast and Graham Quirk in front of Olympic rings.

props.synopsis: John Coates and Graham Quirk have given evidence at a Senate inquiry into Brisbane 2032, as a bill is tabled to set up an independent delivery authority to operate at arm's length from the government.

title.children: Independent Games authority a step closer as Senate inquiry drills down into planning disputes

image.altText: Hero Image for story

props.synopsis: From a love letter to Australia's flora and fauna to a downright kitschy get-up, here's what our Olympians have worn to opening ceremonies over the years.

title.children: The Paris 2024 opening ceremony uniforms have been unveiled. Here's how Team Australia's look has evolved

image.altText: A happy smiling woman wearing glasses and a brightly coloured scarf over a dark blouse.

props.synopsis: Liberal senator Linda Reynolds has responded to the Federal Court's judgement in the defamation case brought by Bruce Lehrmann against Network 10 and Lisa Wilkinson, saying she is beyond pleased the court "has set the record straight" about her treatment of Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Linda Reynolds says Lehrmann defamation judgement 'set record straight' on claims of cover-up

image.altText: Tasmanian Devil standing on leaves with mouth wide open

props.synopsis: The tooth could provide further historical evidence of inter-community trading in Western Australia and was unearthed in Juukan Gorge, which made headlines in 2020 when its rock shelters were damaged by Rio Tinto blasts.

title.children: Why this Tassie devil tooth unearthed in a far corner of Australia could rewrite history

image.altText: A woman smiles and poses for a photo that has been overlayed with a sepia filter, adjusting the colour to give it a yellow tone

props.synopsis: Rachael Dixon, a 53-year-old Melbourne woman, died after ingesting a drink at a regional Victorian wellness centre that was made with mushrooms. Here's what we know.

title.children: Operator of Victorian wellness centre speaks after death of Melbourne woman

image.altText: An elderly couple wearing masks walk on the Bondi beach boardwalk.

props.synopsis: Fresh data from the Bureau of Statistics Time Use Survey provides a snapshot of how different generations spent their leisure and recreation time during 2020-21.

title.children: What did you do with all your free time during COVID? Data shows how each generation compared

image.altText: Gavin Webb holds a bass while sitting on stage.

props.synopsis: One of the founding members of Australian rock band The Masters Apprentices, Gavin Webb, has died aged 77 after a six-year battle with cancer.

title.children: Founding member of The Masters Apprentices Gavin Webb dies

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds up a dollar coin while standing in the House of Representatives

props.synopsis: The good news is there's likely to be some change to Australia's HELP scheme, and we're likely to hear about it soon, in the lead-up to the May budget. The bad news for borrowers is it won't be debt relief of the kind Biden is offering.

title.children: Albanese's budget will likely include changes to student debt. Here's what that could look like

image.altText: A plane on a runway with high water around it

props.synopsis: Dubai's major international airport diverts scores of incoming flights as heavy rains flood the United Arab Emirates after leaving 18 dead in Oman.

title.children: 'I like to play in the rain but this scares me': Storms disrupt flights in Dubai after killing 18 in Oman

image.altText: A man looks at a computer screen. He is wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Andrew Ryder was recovering from a $10,000 fraud attack when his Optus account was hacked a second time.

title.children: Optus customer who lost $10,000 from bank will leave telco after second fraud attack

image.altText: View of the High Court of Australia sign in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for an Iranian man demanding to be released from detention have told the High Court their client would be prepared to be sent to anywhere other than Iran, even war-ravaged Gaza.

title.children: Lawyers tell High Court Iranian man facing deportation would rather be sent to Gaza than back to Iran

image.altText: A green comet streaking through a star studded sky

props.synopsis: Australians will be able to see comet 12P/Pons-Brooks aka the 'Devil Comet' this week even without a telescope or binoculars. Here's how to spot it and snap a photo.

title.children: Want to see the 'Devil Comet' at its brightest? If you miss it, you’ll have to wait another 71 years
